newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Forex deposits of Manila banks up at $16.58 bln.
newsitem.headline: Forex deposits of Manila banks up at $16.58 bln.

text.p: The total foreign currency deposits of commercial banks in the Philippines increased to $16.58 billion as of June 20 this year, the Central Bank said on Friday.
The level was $4.85 billion higher than a year ago.

"Since these deposits are considered a secondary buffer or reserve in servicing the country's foreign exchange needs, this favourable development adds more stability to the local currency," a Central Bank statement said.
Foreign currency deposits are mostly foreign exchange receipts of exporters and remittances of overseas Filipino workers.
The Central Bank sold dollars heavily earlier this week to curb the depreciation of the Philippine peso.
The Central Bank has not disclosed its gross international reserves level since.
